title: Drawing, "Design for Textile-Inventory Card", 1952–69
medium: Pink, brick red and red colored pencil on white tracing paper fastened to white cardboard with two staples
inscribed: In colored pencil lower right the letter "a" inscribed in a circle; Verso of cardboard mount in graphite upper left corner: II - 6
provenance: This collection was donated to the Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum in 1969 by Alexander Girard
dimensions:
10 x 12.4cm (3 15/16 x 4 7/8in.)
Other (cardboard mount): 10 x 16.4 cm (3 15/16 x 6 7/16 in.)
description: White diamond motif on repeating bands of pink, brickred and red.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Design for Textile-Inventory Card", 1952–69.Pink, brick red and red colored pencil on white tracing paper fastened to white cardboard with two staples. Gift of Alexander H. Girard. 1969-165-424.
